metadata.title: CVE-2018-18066 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
snmp_oid_compare in snmplib/snmp_api.c in Net-SNMP before 5.8 has a NULLPointer Exception bug that can be used by an unauthenticated attacker toremotely cause the instance to crash via a crafted UDP packet, resulting inDenial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18066` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
